snippet: Phil Libin, chief executive officer of Evernote says it has an unusual culture: unlimited vacations (if you get your work done), no office phones and a robot that lets him communicate with the staff when he is away.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features interview with Phil Libin, chief executive officer of Evernote, discussing the unusual culture at the company and his management philosophy.
lead_paragraph: Phil Libin, chief executive officer of Evernote says it has an unusual culture: unlimited vacations (if you get your work done), no office phones and a robot that lets him communicate with the staff when he is away.

headline.print_headline: Here’s $1,000. Now Please Take Your Vacation.
headline.seo: Phil Libin of Evernote, on Its Unusual Corporate Culture
headline.main: The Phones Are Out, but the Robot Is In
